instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: [SOLVED]New 1502 1tb
threads.message: Don't think this is a board issue. Have a 2015 1502 with no physical damage. 1tb ssd. Boots to log in, then turns off after password is entered. This is my wife's computer and it for sure has not been damaged. Tried to restore, won't allow, tried to reinstall OS X, won't allow and says "AMD-Action:authenticate:SP" at Apple ID entry time. Help?

threads.title: [SOLVED]New 1502 1tb
threads.message:
I've seen this with corrupted filevault volumes. Diskwarrior can usually fix this if the original volume can be mounted.

no idea about "AMD-Action:authenticate:SP"

threads.title: [SOLVED]New 1502 1tb
threads.message:
[QUOTE="Gurmon, post: 23078"]I've seen this with corrupted filevault volumes. Diskwarrior can usually fix this if the original volume can be mounted.

no idea about "AMD-Action:authenticate:SP"[/QUOTE]

How would I go about doing this with disk warrior?

threads.title: [SOLVED]New 1502 1tb
threads.message:
[QUOTE="Rford, post: 23080"]

How would I go about doing this with disk warrior?[/QUOTE]

Quite easily. Do you have a Diskwarrior 5 ?
Just to rule out software issues, have you tried booting with a known good volume ?

threads.title: [SOLVED]New 1502 1tb
threads.message: Date and time is correct? Also do you have a externel usb drive to install osx, just for testing.

threads.title: [SOLVED]New 1502 1tb
threads.message:
Got it guys, 
Thanks for your help
